title.value: Leishmania parasites exchange drug-resistance genes through extracellular vesicles
title.justification: The title is the main focus of the paper, investigating the mechanism of drug-resistance gene transfer between parasites via extracellular vesicles.
title.quote: Leishmania parasites exchange drug-resistance genes through extracellular vesicles

extractions.description: The paper investigates how Leishmania parasites transfer drug-resistance genes between themselves using extracellular vesicles (EVs). It highlights the role of EVs in horizontal gene transfer (HGT) and the enrichment of drug-resistance genes within these vesicles. The study demonstrates that this mechanism contributes to the increased fitness and survival of parasites in hostile environments.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results demonstrating the transfer of drug-resistance genes through EVs and the consequent changes in phenotype of the recipient parasites.
type.quote: Herein, we investigate the DNA content of EVs derived from drug-resistant parasites, as well as the EVsâ€™ potential to act as shuttles for DNA transfer.

name.justification: The research focuses on cellular processes and mechanisms involving extracellular vesicles and gene transfer in Leishmania parasites.
name.quote: Extracellular vesicles (EVs) are nanometric membrane-enclosed particles released into the extracellular space by organisms belonging to almost all living kingdoms; they serve as mediators of intercellular communication.

name.justification: The study revolves around the parasitic behavior of Leishmania and their interactions through EVs.
name.quote: Leishmania are eukaryotic parasites that have retained the ability to produce extracellular vesicles (EVs) through evolution.

name.justification: The research involves genomic analysis, particularly looking at DNA content within EVs and their role in gene transfer.
name.quote: Next-generation sequencing and PCR assays confirm the enrichment of amplicons carrying drug-resistance genes associated with EVs.
